meanings.definition: Division into many parts or categories.
meanings.sent1: The polychotomy of the animal kingdom includes mammals, birds, reptiles, and more.
meanings.sent2: The polychotomy of colors includes red, blue, green, and yellow.
meanings.sent3: At the store, the polychotomy of ice cream flavors left me indecisive.
meanings.sent4: The polychotomy of opinions on the topic was evident during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The polychotomy of shapes in the puzzle made it challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing into multiple branches or groups.
meanings.sent1: The polychotomy of the company's departments made communication difficult.
meanings.sent2: The polychotomy of the family tree revealed distant relatives.
meanings.sent3: The polychotomy of teams in the game led to an unexpected outcome.
meanings.sent4: The polychotomy of paths in the forest confused the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The polychotomy of interests among the students created diverse friendships.
